description: A medium-sized white cockatoo, also known as a Little Corella, with a distinctive bare, greyish-blue patch of skin around its eyes. They are known for their playful and comical nature.
temperament: Extremely playful, intelligent, and outgoing. They can be very affectionate and are known for being clowns. They are also less prone to the high-strung nature of larger cockatoos.
loudness: Loud. While maybe not as deafening as a Moluccan, they have a very loud call and enjoy using it, especially in the morning and evening.
vocalization: Can be very good talkers, with a clear ability to mimic words and phrases. They are also very vocal with a variety of squawks and calls.
dietaryNeeds: A high-quality pelleted diet should form the base. Supplement with fresh vegetables, some fruit, and limited nuts. They are prone to obesity.
healthPointers: A hardy species with a lifespan of 50+ years. Prone to PBFD and fatty liver disease if on an improper diet. Their playful nature requires a lot of enriching toys.
housing: Can be challenging for apartments due to their noise level. They need a very durable cage with a strong lock, as they are clever escape artists. Minimum size: 36"W x 24"D x 48"H.
